bibl.note: This is a letter from Joseph McMinn, U.S. agent to the Cherokee Indians at the Cherokee Agency in Tennessee, to John C. Calhoun, Secretary of War, dated October 27, 1824. McMinn reports to Calhoun on the claim of Mr. Elsworth, superintendent of the Brainerd Mission, and the Cherokee Nation that they are due funds for the construction of a building to house female students at the mission school. McMinn refers to previous correspondence between Return J. Meigs, his predecessor at the Cherokee Agency, and Calhoun on this matter.

div1.p: Mr. Elsworth the Superintendent of the Brainard Mission, in the Cherokee Nation was at this place a few days since, for the purpose of bringing to a close the accounts, between this Agency and the Brainard establishment; relative to the building for the use of the females of that institution. - On Referring to your letter of the 16th November 1820. directed to Col. Return J Meigs, I find that you had directed him to include in his quarterly estimates, the sum that may be necessary, from time to time, for this purpose; taking care not to exceed the sum of $1000.00

Mr. Elsworth seems to be impressed with the Opinion that the establishment has only received the sum of $666.66 2/3 cents out of the $1000.00 appropriated
for the building of the female academy
On refering to the Books of this office I find the following Payments, which were made by Col. Meigs to the Superintendent of Brainard

(To witt)
April
Paid the Revd Ard. Hoyt in the 1st qrt. 1820
$100.00
15th June
Ditto Alijah Conger in the 2nd qrt. 1820
127.61 1/4
$227.61 1/4
to complete the expense for some out -buildings establishing a house to Seperate the Sexes of Indian youths at Brainard School, both these items was authorised by the president of the United States
$100.61 1/4
Paid to the Revd. A. Hoyt 13th June 1821
333.33 1/3
Do. do. Do. 7th Septr. 1821
333.33 1/3
$894.28

The above sum of $ 894.28 cents, is the whole amount that appears upon the Books of this Office as having been paid towards the building of the female; and Should the sum of $227.61 1/4 cents (as authorised by the President) not be included as a part of the
$1000.00. then will be a balance yet due the establishment of $333.33 1/3 Cents as Claimed by them

closer.salute: I have the honor to be Most Respectfully Your Obt Servant
